Name: Wren Hall
Place: Choristers' Green, The Close, Salisbury. SP1 2EL
Date: 14/15th century wing of Braybrook House rebuilt in 1714
Notes: Originally a cathedral choristers' school, now used as a cathedral education centre.

Name: Braybrooke House
Notes: Initially residential, now a resource centre.

Name: Hemingsby House
Place: Choristers' Green, The Close, Salisbury. SP1 2EL
Notes: Former canonry, has appearance of two houses.

Name: The King's House
Place: West Walk, The Close, Salisbury. SP1 2EG
Notes: Originally the residence of the Abbot of Sherborne, now a museum.

Name: Retaining Wall, Screen Railing, Piers and Gates of No. 68 West Walk
Place: 68 West Walk, The Close, Salisbury. SP1 2EN
Notes: Iron decorative screen with gate and low wall.

Name: The Walton Canonry
Place: No. 96 West Walk, The Close, Salisbury. SP1 2EN
Notes: A private residence, named from earlier resident, Canon Walton, son of the angler, still residential.

Name: Leaden Hall
Place: West Walk, The Close, Salisbury. SP1 2EP
Notes: Original site of canonical house of Elias of Dereham, now part of a private school.

Name: South Gate or Harnham Gate and Gatehouse
Notes: Archway, gate and gatehouse. Southern gate into Cathedral Close.
